channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Grandparents Day
item.description:
Sunday, 26 October 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to celebrate Grandparents Day

Queensland Grandparents Day 2025 will bring together people of all ages, cultures and abilities. This will also be a special way to pay tribute and celebrate our dear grandparents.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Families, Seniors, Disability Services and Child Safety

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Rugby League Pacific Championships
item.description:
Sunday, 26 October 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Red, White and Blue, alternating with Red and White in celebration of the Rugby League Pacific Championships.

The Pacific’s biggest sporting event returns to Brisbane.

Suncorp Stadium plays host on Sunday 26th October to the pride and passion as Rugby League’s Pacific superstars show their national colours and represent their cultures with Tonga XIII taking on Toa Samoa.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council



Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: World Polio Day
item.description:
Monday, 27 October 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support Polio Awreness Month

October is Polio Awareness Month with World Polio Day recognised on October 24. There are ongoing efforts to eradicate polio, much progress has been made but we are concerned that some Australians are still living with long term effects of polio. Our aim is to strive to make people aware of this preventable disease.

This Light Up is organised by: Rotary Club of New Farm

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: 2025 International Mastocytosis and Mast Cell Diseases Awareness Day
item.description:
Tuesday, 28 October 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Purple to support 2025 International Mastocytosis and Mast Cell Diseases Awareness Day

The International Mastocytosis & Mast Cell Diseases Awareness Day aims to spread the word about a family of diseases that range from moderately disruptive to life-threatening forms. This annual awareness day is the result of a collaborative decision made by 24 mast cell disease advocacy groups, with the first Day commemorated in 2018. It represents the one day in the year to direct attention to these rare diseases. A day that will bring mast cell organisations together to highlight the impact of the diseases in patients’ lives and the importance of research and education in the acceptance of diversity. It aims to raise awareness and understanding of the need for more accurate diagnostics, better treatments, and further investments in research. A day that will lift up the hopes of mast cell patients all over the world in dreaming of a brighter future. The #SpotOurSpots campaign is the Australia and Aotearoa New Zealand initiative for the Awareness Day.

This Light Up is organised by: The Australasian Mastocytosis Society

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Eve of Bandanna Day
item.description:
Wednesday, 29 October 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue and Green to support the Eve of Bandanna Day

Bandanna Day is the flagship fundraising and awareness campaign for Canteen. Since Bandanna Day began it has raised more than $35 million to support young people impacted by cancer.
On 30 October, we ask participants to buy a bandanna and wear it in solidarity with over 23,000 young people who are impacted by cancer every year.

This Light Up is organised by: Canteen

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Eve of World Teachers Day
item.description:
Thursday, 30 October 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple, Blue and Green to celebrate the Eve of World Teachers Day

World Teachers' Day is a significant, unique, wonderful & highly appreciated way of promoting the importance of the teaching profession & helps to celebrate the important work of teachers. Quality teaching of our current & future generations is vital to Brisbane's, and our state's, future. Teachers have often felt under-appreciated in the past, and this light-up very successfully helps to recognise, celebrate and promote this crucial profession.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Education

item.title: Day for Daniel
item.description:
Friday, 31 October 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Red to support Day for Daniel

Now in its 21st year, Day for Daniel, to be held on Friday 31 October 2025, endeavours to raise awareness of child safety, protection, and harm prevention. Day for Daniel is Australia’s largest child safety education and awareness day. The Daniel Morcombe Foundation was established in 2005 by Bruce and Denise Morcombe. The Foundation is driven by a vision of a world where children and young people are safe, supported, and equipped with the tools to navigate their world confidently and securely.

This Light Up is organised by: Daniel Morcombe Foundation

item.title: 80 Years of QIMR Berghofer
item.description:
Saturday, 1 November 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Maroon to celebrate 80 Years of QIMR Berghofer

The Queensland Institute of Medical Research, now known as QIMR Berghofer, is one of Australia’s most successful medical research institutes, translating discoveries from bench to bedside for a better future of health. As part of the 80th birthday celebration of the Queensland Institute of Medical Research we want to share with all Queenslanders our official anniversary and celebrate 80 years of pioneering medical research in Queensland.

This Light Up is organised by: The Queensland Institute of Medical Research

Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Eve of Colour the World Orange
item.description:
Sunday, 2 November 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Orange to support Eve of Colour the World Orange

Colour the World Orange Day is an annual event held on the first Monday in November to raise awareness about Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS) and Reflex Sympathetic Dystrophy (RSD). It's a day for people affected by CRPS/RSD, along with their families and supporters, to come together and promote awareness of this condition. Activities include wearing orange, lighting up landmarks in orange, and using social media to spread information and support.

This Light Up is organised by: CRPS Awareness - The Purple Bucket Foundation INC.

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Monday, 3 November 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support the Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal

The Lord Mayor’s Charitable Trust has been caring for the Brisbane community since the 1950s. Through a range of critical grant rounds, facilitating connections and support to local and grassroots charities, The Trust makes an impact on Brisbane’s biggest community challenges and most vulnerable residents. The Trust exists to support Brisbane’s frontline charities.
Every year, the Lord Mayor’s Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal raises much needed funds to spread some festive cheer to support charities in Brisbane. In 2024, the Christmas Appeal allowed the Trust to present grants to 93 different charities, bringing joy to families desperately in need within our community. Your support, no matter how big or small, you can make a genuine difference this festive season.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Dysautonomia Awareness
item.description:
Tuesday, 4 November 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Teal to support Dysautonomia Awareness

Dysautonomia (pronounced dis-oughta?-no-me-uh) is an umbrella term that includes many different diseases of the autonomic nervous system. Over 70 million people worldwide live with a form of dysautonomia. The autonomic nervous system controls all of the involuntary functions of the body, like heart rate, blood pressure, digestion, and temperature control. Some forms of dysautonomia are mild, while others are fatal, but all forms of dysautonomia can be very debilitating. People with dysautonomia often suffer for years undiagnosed, due to a lack of awareness. With your help, we can change that!

This Light Up is organised by: Dysautonomia International

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

Some forms of dysautonomia are mild, while others are fatal, but all forms of dysautonomia can be very debilitating. People with dysautonomia often suffer for years undiagnosed, due to a lack of awareness. With your help, we can change that!

This Light Up is organised by: Dysautonomia International

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Wednesday, 5 November – Thursday, 6 November 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Purple to support the Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal

The Lord Mayor’s Charitable Trust has been caring for the Brisbane community since the 1950s. Through a range of critical grant rounds, facilitating connections and support to local and grassroots charities, The Trust makes an impact on Brisbane’s biggest community challenges and most vulnerable residents. The Trust exists to support Brisbane’s frontline charities.
Every year, the Lord Mayor’s Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal raises much needed funds to spread some festive cheer to support charities in Brisbane. In 2024, the Christmas Appeal allowed the Trust to present grants to 93 different charities, bringing joy to families desperately in need within our community. Your support, no matter how big or small, you can make a genuine difference this festive season.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: The Lord Mayor's Business Awards
item.description:
Thursday, 6 November 2025

City Hall will be lit Green to celebrate The Lord Mayor's Business Awards

In 2025, the Lord Mayor’s Business Awards (LMBA) marks its 20th year, making this a significant milestone in celebrating two decades of business success stories.
This event honours outstanding businesses and individuals, celebrates the outstanding achievements of Brisbane businesses and the contributions to the city’s economic growth, innovation, and liveability all while showcasing Brisbane as a leading city for business and innovation.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: NAWIC Women in Construction 30th Anniversary
item.description:
Friday, 7 November 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Red and Pink to celebrate NAWIC Women in Construction 30th Anniversary

The National Association of Women in Construction is a not-for-profit organisation advocating for the advancement and recognition of women in the construction industry. Now in their 30th year, the NAWIC is celebrating the achievements and contributions of women across all disciplines in construction. With Brisbane and SEQ entering a once-in-a-generation infrastructure boom, and preparations underway for the Brisbane 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games, there is a timely and strategic opportunity for the City of Brisbane to amplify its celebrate for women in construction, a workforce critical to delivering major city-shaping projects.

This Light Up is organised by: National Association of Women in Construction

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: MELT Festival - River Pride Parade
item.description:
Saturday, 8 November 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit All Colours to celebrate MELT Festival - River Pride Parade

Make the Brisbane River/Maiwar sparkle!
River Pride Parade returns Saturday 08 November 2025, celebrating our LGBTQIA+ communities and allies in true Brisbane style...by boat! From yachts to paddleboards, join the colourful flotilla cruising from West End to Brisbane Powerhouse.
Rally your crew or share with a boat-loving friend and let’s turn the river into a moving rainbow.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: NeuroEndocrine Cancer Day
item.description:
Sunday, 9 November 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue and White to support NeuroEndocrine Cancer Day

euroendocrine Cancer (NET) Day aims to increase public awareness about neuroendocrine cancers, which are diagnosed in one Australian every 90 minutes, with incidence rates on the rise, making this little known, poorly understood disease Australia?s 7th most commonly diagnosed cancer.
By lighting up Brisbane landmarks, NECA seeks to draw attention to the challenges faced by NET patients, Due to the vague symptoms mimicking other conditions 50% of patients are misdiagnosed, with 60% diagnosed at stage four (when the disease is no longer curable) This campaign aims to raise awareness to of NETs to encourage and enable early detection, so there is more chance of a cure and ultimately save lives.

This Light Up is organised by: NeuroEndocrine Cancer Australia

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.description:
Sunday, 9 November 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Blue and White to support NeuroEndocrine Cancer Day

euroendocrine Cancer (NET) Day aims to increase public awareness about neuroendocrine cancers, which are diagnosed in one Australian every 90 minutes, with incidence rates on the rise, making this little known, poorly understood disease Australia?s 7th most commonly diagnosed cancer.
By lighting up Brisbane landmarks, NECA seeks to draw attention to the challenges faced by NET patients, Due to the vague symptoms mimicking other conditions 50% of patients are misdiagnosed, with 60% diagnosed at stage four (when the disease is no longer curable) This campaign aims to raise awareness to of NETs to encourage and enable early detection, so there is more chance of a cure and ultimately save lives.

This Light Up is organised by: NeuroEndocrine Cancer Australia

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Eve of Remembrance Day
item.description:
Monday, 10 November – Tuesday, 11 November 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to commemorate the Eve of Remembrance Day

Will you Remember to Remember?
1 minute. 11AM. 11 November.
This Remembrance Day, join us in honouring those who gave their lives in service.
11 November marks the anniversary of the Armistice that ended fighting with Germany in World War I. Every year at the 11th hour of the 11th day of the 11th month, millions around the world pause in silence to remember the sacrifices many have made so we can enjoy life today. RSL Sub Branches across Australia will host commemorative services on the morning of Remembrance Day. In Queensland, there will be more than 140+ Sub Branch services, as well as the State ceremony at the Shrine of Remembrance, ANZAC Square, Brisbane.

This Light Up is organised by: RSL Queensland

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: National Recycling Week
item.description:
Wednesday, 12 November 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Yellow to support National Recycling Week

National Recycling Week is a great opportunity to remind our residents how important it is to recycle right. Lighting up the Story Bridge helps shine a light on the message of getting the right thing in the right bin. It’s about helping residents understand what can and can’t be recycled, reducing contamination and making sure our recycling efforts make a difference. This will support our work to build a cleaner, more sustainable Brisbane.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset
